metadata.feature_description: Configure template-specific settings like name, description, keywords, and URL

steps.action: Navigate to Manage > Templates in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Page Templates panel opens with list of existing templates
steps.actual: Page Templates panel opened showing 5 existing templates

steps.expected: Add Template form appears with Template Name field
steps.actual: Add Template form appeared with Template Name, Description fields and Page Template selector

steps.action: Enter 'Test Settings Template' in Template Name field
steps.expected: Template name is entered in the field
steps.actual: Template name 'Test Settings Template' was entered successfully

steps.action: Enter description text in Description field
steps.actual: Description 'This is a test template created to verify template page settings functionality.' was entered successfully

steps.action: Click Create button after filling template name and description
steps.expected: Template is created and appears in the templates list
steps.actual: Template 'Test Settings Template' was created successfully and appeared in the templates list

steps.action: Click Add Template and enter existing template name 'Test Settings Template'

steps.expected: Validation error displayed for duplicate name
steps.actual: Error message displayed: 'The Template Name you chose is already being used for another template.'

steps.action: Clear Template Name field and click Create
steps.expected: Required field validation error is displayed
steps.actual: Validation message 'This field is required.' displayed below the empty Template Name field

observations: Template settings (name, description) are configured during template creation via the Add Template form
Keywords/SEO settings mentioned in feature description are not visible in the Add Template UI - may be configured elsewhere or not implemented in this module
URL configuration is not visible in the Add Template form - URLs are auto-generated based on template name
The Page Template selector requires an existing template to be selected as the base for new templates
